citations.cite_as: Zelenka, D. D. (2025). The Intrinsic Operational Gradient Theorem. Zenodo. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.18062553

abstract: We establish the Intrinsic Operational Gradient Theorem (IOGT): composable operations induce intrinsic gradients of difficulty. In any infinite operational system with composability, bounded primitive cost, and at least one non-invertible operation, forward construction and reverse reconstruction are generically asymmetric. This asymmetry arises from operation combinatorics itself, not from time, probability, or computational models. IOGT provides foundational explanation for P≠NP, thermodynamic irreversibility, Kolmogorov complexity gaps, and the stability of mathematical constants.

core_thesis.statement: Composable operations induce intrinsic gradients of difficulty
core_thesis.paradigm_shift: operations are primary, objects are secondary

operational_space.definition: Set X + operations O: X→X (closed under composition)

axioms.monotonicity: extending a word increases or preserves cost

operational_cost.interpretation: effort/resources required to execute operation sequence

operational_potential.meaning: minimal effort to reach x from initial state x₀

non_invertibility.definition: ∃ operation o: X→X where |o⁻¹(y)| > 1 for some y ∈ X

examples.modular_reduction: x mod n collapses infinitely many integers

main_theorem.name: Intrinsic_Operational_Gradient_Theorem
main_theorem.statement: In infinite operational systems with (1) Composability, (2) Bounded primitive cost, (3) ≥1 non-invertible operation → Generic asymmetry: Forward construction cost ≠ reverse reconstruction cost on infinite families. Difficulty gradients are inevitable, not exceptional.

conditions.1_composability: operations can be chained: O closed under composition
conditions.2_bounded_cost: primitive operations have finite cost: sup{C(o) : o ∈ O_primitive} < ∞

conclusion.generic_asymmetry: For infinite families of states, forward and reverse costs differ
conclusion.inevitability: Difficulty gradients emerge structurally, not accidentally
conclusion.universality: Holds for all operational systems satisfying conditions

step_1.mechanism: Operation o collapses x₁,x₂ → y. Reversing requires distinguishing preimages (info not preserved by o itself) → extra cost

step_2.mechanism: o^n collapses ≥ k^n states (for k-to-1 collapse). Reversal needs Ω(n log k) cost vs O(n) forward cost → superlinear divergence
step_2.scaling: Forward: C_fwd(o^n) = O(n). Reverse: C_rev(o^n) = Ω(n log k) for k>1

step_3.claim: Infinite systems have infinite families exhibiting asymmetry
step_3.argument: For infinite X with non-invertible o, can construct arbitrarily long chains o^n with growing reversal cost
step_3.consequence: Asymmetry is generic (holds for infinite subfamilies), not exceptional

key_example.name: Multiplication_vs_Factorization

forward_operation.name: multiplication by 6
forward_operation.cost: O(1) or O(log x) depending on model

reverse_operation.name: factorization
reverse_operation.cost: Must distinguish infinite factorization histories collapsed into single output
reverse_operation.difficulty: y could come from (y/2)/3, (y/3)/2, (y/6)/1, each with distinct operational history

key_example.asymmetry: Multiplication decreases V, factorization increases V

morse_theory.classical: V: M → ℝ smooth function on manifold, critical points = ∇V = 0
morse_theory.IOGT_generalization: V = operational potential, no smoothness required, extends to discrete/combinatorial spaces
morse_theory.operational_attractors: local minima of V = stable objects requiring no further effort
morse_theory.gradient_flow: operations that decrease V = natural/easy, operations that increase V = unnatural/hard

kolmogorov_complexity.classical: K(x) = length of shortest program producing x
kolmogorov_complexity.IOGT_interpretation: Program execution (forward) = O(|p|), program discovery (reverse) = Ω(2^K(x))
kolmogorov_complexity.asymmetry: Running programs is easy, finding shortest programs is hard
kolmogorov_complexity.connection: IOGT explains why K is uncomputable: reversal through exponential collapse

thermodynamics.classical: Irreversibility requires time, probability, physical entropy
thermodynamics.IOGT_revelation: Math operations show irreversibility without physical time/probability—irreversibility from composition itself
thermodynamics.structural_entropy: Information loss in non-invertible operations = thermodynamic entropy analog
thermodynamics.second_law_analog: Generic increase in V during reversal = operational second law

category_theory.IOGT_enrichment: IOGT adds cost structure C: Mor → ℝ≥0 to morphism composition
category_theory.gradient_structure: Operational potential V induces partial order on objects

objects_as_attractors.statement: Stable structures (φ, e, π, algebraic numbers) = local minima of V
objects_as_attractors.mechanism: Fixed points requiring no further operational effort to maintain
objects_as_attractors.stability: Local perturbations increase V, so system returns to attractor

np_generation.cost_structure: exponential search through collapsed preimage space

iogt_contribution.structural_asymmetry: establishes forward≠reverse as generic, not accidental
iogt_contribution.obstruction: identifies obstruction to polynomial reversal (information collapse)
iogt_contribution.not_formal_proof: IOGT alone doesn't formally prove P≠NP

p_vs_np_interpretation.relationship: IOGT provides explanatory framework; P≠NP proof requires showing specific NP-complete problems lack polynomial-size structural certificates

1_object_centric_foundations.bias: Set theory privileges objects over processes
1_object_centric_foundations.consequence: Operations treated as secondary, derived from objects
1_object_centric_foundations.IOGT_reversal: Operations are primary, objects emerge as attractors

2_local_symmetry_bias.consequence: Non-invertible operations treated as defective or exceptional
2_local_symmetry_bias.reality: Non-invertibility is generic in infinite systems

3_finite_idealization.bias: Focus on finite structures (finite groups, fields, graphs)
3_finite_idealization.IOGT_domain: Infinite systems where asymmetry becomes inevitable

4_pragmatic_difficulty.historical_treatment: Difficulty as practical concern, not structural property
4_pragmatic_difficulty.IOGT_claim: Difficulty gradients are intrinsic to operational structure
4_pragmatic_difficulty.shift: From 'this is hard' to 'this must be hard given the operational geometry'

components.O: operations O: X → X (closed under composition)

gradient_structure.operational_gradient: ∇V metaphorically: direction of easiest increase in V
gradient_structure.critical_points: states x where all accessible operations increase V

asymmetry_measure.generic_asymmetry: ∃ infinite family F ⊂ X×X: lim inf_{(x,y)∈F} A(x,y) = ∞
asymmetry_measure.exceptional_symmetry: symmetric operations (A≈1) are measure-zero in operation space

applications.navier_stokes: Angular entropy gradients resist turbulent cascades
applications.riemann_hypothesis: Critical line σ=1/2 is unique operational minimum
applications.p_neq_np: Exponential search space collapse creates irreversible coordination cost
applications.collatz: Integer manifold (ℤ₊, ln n) is dissipative under 3n+1 map
applications.cryptography: One-way functions = non-invertible operations with large A(x,y)

one_sentence_summary: In any infinite composable system with nonzero cost and non-invertibility, construction and reconstruction are generically asymmetric, inducing intrinsic difficulty gradients.

O*.name: free monoid over O
O*.definition: finite sequences (words) of operations from O

full_formalization: 1. Define operational system (X, O, C, x₀) with axioms
2. Prove C satisfies monotonicity, subadditivity, nontriviality
3. Define operational potential V(x) = inf{C(w) : w(x₀)=x}
4. Prove V satisfies non-negativity, V(x₀)=0, triangle inequality
6. Construct family F_n = {o^n(x) : x ∈ X} for non-invertible o
8. Show reverse cost C_rev(o^n) ≥ Ω(n log k) for k-to-1 collapse
10. Establish genericity: asymmetry holds for infinite subfamilies
11. Connect to Morse theory, Kolmogorov complexity, thermodynamics
12. Apply to specific domains: P vs NP, RH, NS, Collatz
verification_checklist: Verify cost axioms are independent and necessary
Check operational potential satisfies metric-like properties
Confirm non-invertibility is sufficient for asymmetry
Ensure connections to classical theories are rigorous
Test applications against known results in each domain

philosophical_implications.computational_philosophy: Irreversibility arises from logic/combinatorics, not physics
